question: Doctor Jones!... Doctor Jones !... We need your assistance!
answer: C'mon, Mac... It's the first bite I've had all week...

question: Please... It's very importantl...
answer: Do you value our friendship, Mac?

question: More than me' nightly pint.
answer: Then this better not be some wild goose chase...

question: T'ain't wild geese we're after, Doctor Jones. You got me' word on that... ...and a MacGowan's word is truer than an angel's kiss! That light...only burns after a murder's been committed.
answer: Let's go.

question: Well... Ahmmmm...that is what we're here for...eh, men?...ah... Hennesey... Galbraith... Bottomley... You're comin' with us.
answer: This guy's got one hell of an ego.

question: Baron Seamus Seagrove III. Some say 'e walks the moors every midnight... others claim e's been dead for years... Hennesey?... Hennesey?... Thanks for catchin' me.
answer: I'd rather be catchin' trout. Interesting blood type... Cabernet sauvignon. 1897.

question: Galbraith... You come with me! We'll search for Hennesey... Out here! Bottomley... You go with Doctor Jones... In there.
answer: Let's get outta' here. I need more light. Bottomley?... Bottomley?... Who is it?... Who's there?...

question: Doctor Jones! Try to push!
answer: Can't! There's some kinda' hot ice coverin' the... NOW they bite! Excuse me, sir...? Hello...? Canyou hear me?... still WALKS toward the table. The Baron continues to IGNORE him. Indy is ANNOYED. Listen, pal... There are two dead Policemen upstairs and... Chow time's over, mister. You better start talkin'. There's a lot of strange things happening around here... ...and I want some answers! Do you hear me? I want some answers! Now! Haven't you had enough?

question: Now you can get back to your fishing, Doctor Jones.
answer: No chance, Mac. My plane leaves in the morning. Vacation's over. Gotta' get back to school.

question: 'Tis a shame to go home empty handed... Tell ya' what, my friend... I fancy me'self quite the fisherman... Tomorrow, I'll go out and catch you a real beauty, eh?...
answer: Right. Send it to me airmail.

question: Doctor Jones! A MacGowan's word is truer than...
answer: Yeah, yeah...an angel's kiss. I know.

question: What is it, man? You look as if you've seen a screamin' banshee!
answer: Ah... It was nothing, Mac. Nothing at all.

question: Ah... It was nothing, Mac. Nothing at all.
answer: Hello, Ind -- Doctor Jones.

question: Not now, Betsy.
answer: LOOK at all of those papers!

question: Please, I...
answer: Want me to come by later? Help you grade?

question: Help me grade. Yeah. Sure.
answer: Goodbye, Ind -- Doctor Jones!

question: Huh?... Look, Priestly... I'm real busy...
answer: Doctor Jones, I've had complaints from several of the students -- They feel that you are ignoring them, that you are distracted...

question: Me?... Distracted?...
answer: Marshall University is not the place for sloppy behavior... I have one final warning for you, Doctor Jones --

question: Yes... Oh, Hello, Marcus... Look, can you hold on?... You were saying, sir?
answer: Either you begin concentrating on your --

question: Yes, Marcus... I'm still here... Just hold on! I'm very sorry, sir...
answer: -- concentrating on your teaching duties or --

question: Damn it, Marcus! I'm standing here with Dean... What?.. Just how important?... It is, huh?... Okay. Five minutes. Yeah. I'll be right over. But this better be important, Marcus!
answer: You are on probation, Jones! Ten days! If there is no improvement, you will be dismissed!

question: I promise...by tomorrow...I'll have all of these graded...and DRIED! "F"! This better be important, Marcus... or the museum will soon be displaying my bones. My teaching career is in danger of extinction.
answer: You will not be disappointed, Indiana. ...Look familiar?

question: "Sun wu Kung, The Stone Monkey King". Big deal. That was ten years ago, Marcus. Geez! This Heller kid's got the worst grammar.
answer: Ten years or fifty years. It will always be in your blood.

question: Don't believe this... He spells "repeat" with two "E's".
answer: Think back, Indiana. Remember your desire? Your passion?

question: Kid gets an "A" on content...a "D" on form.
answer: Damn it, man! You can't bury those feelings forever!

question: Two years. Nearly two years of my life...looking for the remains of that Monkey...a piece of his legendary Golden Hooped Rod...or some sign of the Lost City. Nine men perished on the journey. Rest of us nearly died from starvation or one of the many horrible deseases we discovered... We still came back empty handed.
answer: One mustn't give up so easily, Indiana.

question: Give up?!?... Marcus, we spent thirteen months in China!...another seven in India!...
answer: But none in Africa.

question: There was no proof...archeological or anthropological...to indicate that Sun Wu-Kung ever visited Africa...
answer: Until now.

question: Hey... My papers...
answer: The woman is Dr. Clare Clarke. The famous zoologist. She works in Africa, studying animals in their natural habitat.

question: Very interesting, Marcus. Now if you'll turn the lights back on --
answer: Three weeks ago, Dr. Clarke discovered that cute little fellow... "Tyki"...a pygmy of an unusual race...unrelated to any known African tribe...

question: Marcus. The lights.
answer: Dr. Clarke believes that Tyki comes from the Lost Civilization of Sun Wu-Kung.

question: What?... But how did Miss --
answer: "Doctor".

question: "Doctor" Clake. How did she arrive at such a preposterous hypothesis?
answer: The pygmy speaks in a language that has no African origins...but bears a strong resemblance to Chinese.

question: Means nothing. The rivers of Africa have been plagued by various Oriental Pirates and Scavengers since the 16th Century. Not much evidence, Marcus.
answer: There's more. The pygmy was found wearing an ornamental peach stone around his neck...believed to come from Sun Wu-Kung's legendary Garden Of Immortal Peaches.

question: Marcus, there are countless undiscovered African tribes...all with various obscure beliefs and practices... One tribe may wear peach stones... another may wear banana peels...
answer: There is one final bit of evidence...

question: Enlighten me.
answer: The pygmy is over 200 years old.

question: That's impossible.
answer: Dr. Clarke has done a considerable amount of testing on the pygmy's clothing...his sandals...everything was over 200 years old.

question: He's probably wearing his Great Grandfather's stuff. What does all of this have to do with me?
answer: Dr. Clarke wants to mount an expedition to find the Lost City of Sun Wu-Kung. She is quite familiar with your reputation...she'd like you to come along.

question: No chance.
answer: There will be money involved... The museum is willing to fund the expedition...

question: Sorry, Marcus. I've burned this bridge.
answer: Indiana...

question: Marcus. Please. I've got to finish these...
answer: You've got to finish something much more important. You crossed the threshold over a decade ago...and it's been tearing at your insides ever since. My friend, if there is even one iota of truth in Dr. Clarke's findings... then you can lift the veil of mystery that has surrounded this Chinese legend for Centuries. You may uncover the secrets to a Lost Civilization...and possibly, to man's never ending search for immortality. Indiana... Can you afford to pass up the single most important adventure of your life?

question: You can't do this to me!
answer: C'mon, Betsy. Relax. You're gettin' 'em all wet again.

question: You just can't go away...I mean... Africa is so far away, and...well... I love you, Indy.
answer: Thought we agreed this was s'posed to be casual...

question: You call what happened last night "casual".
answer: My dear...a momentary lapse into passion does not a love affair make.

question: Momentary lapse! So that's all I am to you!
answer: Betsy... Wait... Whatsa' matter with you!... Tryin' to ruin my whip!...

question: If I can't have you... I don't want to live.
answer: Drink this. You'll feel better. C'mon, Betsy... Get a hold of yourself. You're young. There are a lot of other guys...

question: Not like you.
answer: That's true... But that's no reason to stop living! Besides, I'm too old for you. By the time you're seventy five, I'll be... Yeccchhh! I'll be disgusting.

question: Don't leave me, Indy!
answer: Look... You're just a flighty kid. Twenty minutes after I walk out this door, you'll have a date with the college Romeo. Two hours from now, you'll be madly in love with him. By tomorrow, you'll forget I ever existed.

question: Indy! At last we are reunited! Oh, Keechingo, God Of Friendship...I thank you for granting my wish!
answer: I see you haven't changed, Scraggy.

question: Mahootmek, God Of Goodness, say... "Before body make contact with foreign object...one must cast out bad spirits, or -- "
answer: " -- or bad spirits will enter your body!"

question: Yes! You have excellent memory, Indy.
answer: I should! Last time we saw each other...you made me wear the same clothes for 3 weeks straight.

question: Never separate body from clothes, or bad spirits will hide in pockets!
answer: In other words... If people never changed clothes...there would be no evil in the world.

question: Exactly!
answer: I missed all a' your crazy philosophies, Scraggy.

question: Dr. Jones! Forgive me.
answer: No sweat.

question: Thought I was being attacked by a degenerate sailor.
answer: No. Just a degenerate archeologist.

question: Your appearance is deceiving.
answer: Likewise. There must be some mistake... I didn't -- Well, yeah...but...

question: May I call you "Clare"?
answer: Please.

question: Well, Clare... We've obviously got a lot of notes to compare... Let's get started tonight...over dinner.
answer: I'd like that very much.

question: Stowed away in the banana barrel. Ate my way to the bottom.
answer: Charming.

question: Hey, Indy... Who's the babe?
answer: Your intellectual and emotional superior.

question: Yeah...well you're gettin' on my nerves, Miss... Miss...
answer: "Doctor" Clare Clarke.

question: Betsy Tuffet...
answer: As in curds and whey?

question: Listen, sister... You better stay away from Indy...
answer: My dear, he has no interest in me. I've already celebrated my tenth Birthday.

question: Tyki... This is Doctor Jones...
answer: He's a real gentleman.

question: Just basic manners. What it takes most men a lifetime to learn... Tyki's accomplished in two weeks. This is our guide, Scraggy Brier... and Miss Bets-- It appears that Bonzo is attracted to Miss Tuffet's Derfume... Eau De Banana Peel.
answer: Where did you find him?...

question: About ten miles from here. We were on a photographic expedition...in the thick of the jungle... I heard sounds. Whimpering. Moaning. I took a few steps, and found Tyki. He was lying in a shallow swamp...semi conscious...a high fever...nearly dead from exhaustion. He had obviously been travelling on foot for many days, over countless miles... So I brought him back to the compound...nursed him back to health...
answer: Clare, I hate to quibble with your anthropological abilities...

question: Quibble.
answer: ...but if this little fellow is over 200 years old... I mean... What accounts for his youthful appearance?...his vitality?...

question: Tyki was wearing this when I found him. Dr. Jones, you are obviously familiar with the legend of Sun Wu- King's Garden of Immortal Peaches?...
answer: A bite from the fruit of that peach tree would give a person eternal life...make them forever young... STUDYING the peach pit. The fruit fly continues to BUZZ around Indiana's head. There's nothing unusual about this ...nothing to indicate that it's from Sun Wu Kung's garden...

question: This fruit fly had a normal life- span of TWENTY FOUR HOURS. As an experiment...the fly was put in this room...alone...with only the peach stone to sustain its existence. The fly stayed alive for
answer: Sorry.

question: He understands him?
answer: Scraggy knows hundreds of languages... He's the best guide in Africa. Ask Tyki where he came from.

question: What civilization?
answer: Betsy. Keep your trap shut. This doesn't concern you.

question: Fine. Terrific. Who cares about this stuff anyway! We're in a nightclub. We should be havin' fun. C'mon, Indy. Let's dance.
answer: Later.

question: What a buncha' stiffs! Bet you can't dance.
answer: Quite the contrary...I spent several months studying dance.

question: Oh yeah? Whattayou' know?... The Bunny Hop?... The Jitterbug?...
answer: The Bondogea. The Kyebe Kyebe. The Dungumaro.

question: Huh?
answer: African Tribal dances.

question: Never heard of 'em.
answer: Of course not. They're beyond the spectrum of your microscopic world.

question: The Zarnbesi River! It has a reputation for its deadly water snakes...
answer: It would have been Sun Wu Kung's logical path.

question: It will also be our logical path.
answer: Please try to control that monstrous libido of yours!

question: What is that awful aroma?
answer: Scraggy's takin' a shower. He believes that onions keep bad spirits from entering his body.

question: In all my years of anthropology... I've never run across anyone or anything quite like Scraggy.
answer: He's a rare breed. You're looking very lovely.

question: You're looking very lecherous.
answer: Just tryin' to be friendly.

question: Save it for the schoolgirls.
answer: Look, Clare... Betsy's just an anxious archeology student...she admires my work... Who can blame her?... But it's just some kinda' hero worship thing...

question: You're writin' this down?...
answer: I'm keeping an accurate record of our journey.

question: What's that got to do with my personal life?
answer: Evidence. I plan on testifying at your child molestation trial.

question: No animal sounds like that.
answer: Could be "Banseebaba".

question: Banseebaba?
answer: Banseebaba is giant demon from hell. He is 50 feet tall. Breathes fire. Make sound like human never hear before. He is made up of all evil in the world!

question: Whatever the hell it is... It went to sleep for the night. Which is what we should do. is ASLEEP in his CABIN. Suddenly, the door SLOWLY CREAKS OPEN. A SHADOW appears on the cabin wall. COMING TOWARD Indiana. The shadow EXTENDS a hand. The hand GRABS Indy's blanket. Indy WAKES. He LEAPS out of bed and TACKLES the mysterious person. Indy FLIPS on the cabin lamp. The intruder is none other than...BETSY. Indiana PULLS Betsy to her feet. She gives a flirtatious SMILE.
answer: Couldn't sleep. The heat. I'm in the mood for passion.

question: I'm in the mood for isolation.
answer: I'm not leaving. Not till I get a kiss.

question: Betsy...
answer: One kiss. Or I'll scream. I swear. I'll wake the whole boat.

question: You son of a bitch. Scraggy!... No!... Keep goin' straight!... Full steam ahead!...
answer: is CONFUSED by Indy's orders. He SCREAMS back to Indiana. What?... You crazy Indy?... We be crushed!... We smash into rock wall!...

question: still SWORDFIGHTING the Pirate King, SCREAMS to Scraggy. No!... Trust me!... Full steam ahead!... Full steam ahead !...
answer: BLESSES himself. His face is STRONG. CONFIDENT. He REVS the engine. FULL SPEED. He TIGHTLY CLUTCHES the wheel. AIMING the river boat toward the waterfall. continues to rev the RIVER BOAT'S engine. CHANTING various prayers under his breath. In the background, a FEISTY Betsy continues to swordfight.

question: Wait... Free the girl... ...and my friends... ...or I blow your hideout here out of the water!
answer: Good. We will all die.

question: We can take you to the Lost City of Sun Wu Kung!
answer: Hah! Better men than you have tried to find the Lost City... They have all failed. You are a fool.

question: (as the TNT fuse burns
answer: Huh?...

question: The Sacred Pai-Cho Scroll. Don't bother. Only WE can translate it.
answer: The Lost City... Said to have streets paved in gold...treasures far greater than any mortal man could imagine... Your pathetic lives will be spared. For now. But everything we find in the Lost City...belongs to ME.

question: Fat chance, Sinbad. It's 50-50. Or you've got no deal.
answer: It is my way. Or you've got no head.

question: Is there an area... A place where the tide changes?...
answer: In a few hours...the water will be lower...much lower...

question: And the remainder of this wall will be visible?.... We're gonna need light. A lot of light. On this wall.
answer: To my good fortune. You know... We are very much alike, Doctor jones.

question: I doubt that.
answer: We both share a remarkable talent for killing.

question: I've never gotten used to killing, pal. I do it for survival.
answer: I do it for pleasure.

question: This is incredible...this map was obviously used by Sun Wu Kung's disciples...if they were ever lost...
answer: These drawings...they are of the surrounding jungle...

question: Where is that?...
answer: It is located at the most South Eastern part of the jungle...near the mountains... There is a village there. The Mongooboo Tribe.

question: You know them?
answer: Very well. I traded with the chief for many years.

question: We play again?
answer: The game is not yet over, my friend.

question: Oh?
answer: You have lost. You must pay.

question: I don't have money...
answer: No. No. money. Rules of the game declare that I may choose a souvenir. A part of your body. Any part I wish.

question: Dr. Clarke says that you're not really in love with me. You're just trying to prove that you can still attract younger women. You're terrified of getting old.
answer: That's crazy.

question: That's what I told her. I told her that you really did love me.
answer: Well...that's...ah...well...

question: You mean... She was right?...
answer: No... I mean Yes... I mean... No, Betsy. I don't love you.

question: Indy HITS the gas. Indiana LOOKS through the persiscope. His view BLINDED by the clouds.
answer: The tank is a LARGE, GREY BLUR through the clouds. Several DARK, BULKING FIGURES APPEAR! They CLIMB along the ravine sides and tops. The mysterious figures SURROUND the tank. All are holding ENORMOUS BOULDERS over their heads. AIMED at the tank.

question: Indy EASES up on the gas. The tank SLOWS. Suddenly, there is a LOUD CRASH! The tank is HIT. RATTLING. SHAKING. Everyone is TOSSED. Save for Indy, who STAYS at the controls. He continues to GUIDE the tank FORWARD. There is another CRASH. And ANOTHER. And ANOTHER.
answer: The dark figures SHOWER the tank with heavy boulders. The tank's gun barrel SNAPS IN TWO. Headlights SMASH. Its body becomes DENTED.

question: Indiana is TOUGH. PERSISTENT. He continues to move the jolting tank FORWARD. As the surrounding walls CAVE IN. SHATTER. Everyone PANICS.
answer: The injured, wobbling tank moves OUT OF THE CLOUDS. Arriving around the corner from the MOUNTAIN TOP. The countless dark figures continue to FOLLOW the tank. SCURRYING along the ravine sides and tops. The figures EMERGE from the clouds. For the first time, they are VISIBLE. And we see that the figures are TALL... HAIRY... MUSCULAR... GORILLAS! They CONTINUE to assault the tank with boulders.

question: Indiana still attempts to move the tank FORWARD. But the engine begins to COUGH. SPUTTER. And DIES.
answer: The tank COMES TO A SUDDEN STOP. One of the Gorillas emits a BIGS PITCHED SHRIEK. COMMUNICATING with the others. The others PAUSE. They STOP the attack. The Gorillas APPROACH the tank. SLOWLY. CAUTIOUSLY. The apes REACH OUT. TOUCHING the tank's wrecked body. A few of the apes begin to CLIMB onto the tank.

question: This is turning into one helluva nightmare.
answer: I want to see Jones! Your friend makes a wonderful interpreter. "The Nazi Party will exist for one thousand years...and I wish to be alive for every year!" That is a favorite philosophy of our feuher.

question: Your feuher's philosphies belong on a bathroom wall.
answer: This is a very serious matter, Doctor Jones. It could save your life. I understand that somewhere in this City...there is a Garden of... Immortal Peaches?... I want information about this Garden... And I would greatly appreciate it, if you would share everything you know, with me.

question: I don't share anything with Nazis.
answer: Very well. My friends will be here soon. They will rest...enjoy the pleasures of my newfound kingdom... Then we shall exterminate these worthless people! Destroy their City! And we will carry away all of its riches...in pieces. Doctor Jones... Those beasts are anxious to run wild. Free. How long will you be able to ride... before they TEAR YOU IN TWO? Goodbye, Doctor Jones.

question: Heil Hitler!
answer: Heil Hitler!

question: Several Nazis are SPRAWLED on the tank floor. UNCONSCIOUS. UNDRESSED. CAMERA PANS UPWARD. The Gorillas have TAKEN CONTROL of the tank. They have DRESSED THEMSELVES IN NAZI UNIFORMS!
answer: As the battle RAGES around them, the Gorilla's tank makes a sudden U-TURN. It heads straight for the SECOND NAZI TANK. The Gorilla's tank FIRES A DIRECT SHOT at the other Nazi tank. BLAM! The Nazis' tank is BLOWN TO SMITHEREENS.

question: The Gorillas, still dressed as NAZIS, continue to DRIVE THE TANK
answer: The tank SPEEDS TOWARD THE ROWS OF CHARGING NAZI TROOPS. The Nazis STOP. SHOCKED to see their own tank coming at them. But the tank continues to BARREL AHEAD. Many of the Nazis are CRUSHED beneath the heavy tank treads. Others DROP their weapons and RUN. FRIGHTENED.

question: You... You're... Sun Wu Kung?...
answer: You are... Indiana Jones?...

question: Huh?... You know me?
answer: I have watched you for many, many years...from the heavens. I was fascinated by your bravery...your passion...in searching for me.

question: Well, I... Thanks I'm very honored.
answer: The honor is mine, Doctor Jones. You and your friends have saved my city from ruin. I would like to return the favor. The Golden Hooped Rod will be a faithful friend. It is capable of one hundred transformations...and will always remain by your side. I will explore the heavens for another. Surely, my search will be shorter and less hazardous than yours! With my city alive again...I will be able to return to the heavens. Goodbye...my dear friends.

question: She is a wonderful treasure... Eh?...
answer: We had a deal.

question: I have no deals with dead men.
answer: Son of a bitch.

question: Thanks, Scraggy...
answer: Indy!...

question: Where're your bags?
answer: I'm not leaving.

question: Huh?... But, you... You have to finish school.
answer: I'm staying on as Clare's assistant.

question: But you're MY assistant.
answer: Not any more. I'm having my credits transfered.

question: Why?...
answer: Clare is a brilliant teacher.

question: I warned you...
answer: Indy, I've learned a lot from you. But it's time I started concentrating on a career in anthropology...instead of romance.

question: You've certainly developed a mature attitude.
answer: Thanks to you. You know... I always thought of you as my knight in shining armor...

question: Really?
answer: But now, I'll think of you as the Father I never had.

question: Terrific.
answer: Doctor Jones...although your libido is questionable, your bravery and intelligence are exceptional. It has been an honor working with you.

question: Why... Thanks. You know, Clare...there's something...
answer: Yes...

question: ...something I've been wanting to do...
answer: Yes...
